</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Defines the time between condition satisfaction and waypoint finish (randomly from min to max, with an average value mid). </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> waypoint '''setWaypointTimeout''' [min, mid, max] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> waypoint: [[Array]] - format [[Waypoint]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [min, mid, max]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> min: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> mid: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> max: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER5</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 00:32, 12 December 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lucky44|Lucky44]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The example doesn't seem to make sense, according to the listed syntax. It seems to set a Max time greater than the Mid time.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on  03:30, 12 December 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tom 48 97|Tom 48 97]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
If mid is greater than max, the result will be really near the mid value.
Results with the values of the example: 8.237, 9.383, 10.425, 9.417, 9.43401, 10.425, 9.90601, 9.96701, 9.42401, 9.42502, 9.96698, 9.89999...
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
